body:
<!-- Anything that looks like this is a comment and can't be seen after the Pull Request is created. -->

# PR Summary

If the user has a UICulture other than en-US, help content is not available and does not successfully update.  The user may not know how to get the en-US content.  Fix is to update the error informing the user how to choose en-US content.

## PR Context

Help content is currently only available as en-US.  If the user has a different culture, it does not fallback to en-US which is expected due to geopolitical reasons we cannot assume it is correct to always fallback to en-US automatically.

comments.body:
>  due to geopolitical reasons we cannot assume it is correct to always fallback to en-US automatically.

We could add new config/gpo parameter UseHelpFallbackCulture so that users can explicitly say that they want download help files in en-US or another culture.
It is very flexible. If I installed a module without ru-RU localization I could get en-US help files without extra steps.
